result.execSummary:
The defendant Toney J. Crook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber and consecutive to any other sentence, though, specifically, Court has ordered Def to report to the Richland County Jail anytime on or before December 31, 2016 (check-in time not specified).  Costs have been ordered remitted by the Court.  Credit for time served to be determined.

JOC AMENDED 2-10-17:  Credit set at 45 days.

records.addlTxt: RCSD Dispo of warrant or commitment
for Sentence Credit:  45 days for 15CM218 and 16CM7; 0 days for 16CF53

Defendant Toney J. Crook in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing in 15CM218, 16CF53, and 16CM7.

Def has already pled and been found guilty on count 1 in 15CM218, counts 1 and 2 in 16CF53, and count 1 in 16CM7.  DA states recommendations as contained in PSI.  Court notes clarification in recommendation as stated by DA, confirmed by clerk's record of the plea hearing in July:  recommendation for sentencing is for counts 1 and 2, not counts 1 and 3 in 16CF53.  In that case, Def, pleaded to count 1/possession of drug paraphernalia and count 2/felony bail jumping.

PSI author, Agent Ihm, present for the hearing.

Court orders sentence as follows:

16CF53 - Count 1 - sentence withheld for 1 year probation; Count 3 - sentence withheld for 3 years probation.  Conditions of probation - as recommended by PSI - maintain absolute sobriety, pay court costs, imposed in 16CF53 as condition of probation; attend, pay for, and succ. complete any treatment or programming; no contact with D & Z's One Stop; submit DNA sample.

15CM218 - 60 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  No costs.

16CM7 - 4 months jail, concurrent to sentence in 15CM218 but consecutive to the sentence in Sauk County.  Total time:  4 months.  Huber granted.  No costs.

DA asks for "date certain" for def to report to jail in Richland County.  Court orders def to report in Richland County on or before 12/31 - time not specified.

Credit information to be provided by counsel.  Atty. Bartelt has offered to get and provide this info.

Def to submit DNA sample today at RCSD and then sign up for probation.
Sentencing hearing on November 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

3 cases called together (16CM7, 15CM218 & 16CF53). DA Harper for the State. Def in person and with Atty Bartelt. Parties state resolution as listed and jointly request a PSI.

15CM218-Plea to count 1, all other counts dismissed/read in
16CM7- plea to count 1, all other counts dismissed/read in. 
16CF53-plea to counts 1 and 2, all other charges dismissed/read in. 

Guilty pleas entered. Colloquy re. plea waiver. Factual basis found, finding of guilt. Court will order pre-sentence. Sentencing scheduled.
Plea hearing on July 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Toney J. Crook in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  3 cases called together for status:  16CM7, 15CM218, and 16CF53.  Atty. B states resolution is in the works; asks for plea hearing; anticipates parties will be asking for PSI in the felony case.  7/5 at 2:30, plea hearings in all matters.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Def from the R Co Jail

Crook appeared by video means.  16CF53/adjourned initial and 16CM7 and 15CM218/status.  In 16CF53, Def waives his right to prelim.  Court's colloquy re waiver.  Probable cause found.  Arraignment completed.  NG entered.  Status requested and set in all three matters.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
